channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou and the team receive a visit from a former Chelsea footballer who has brought along some expensive watches. James is also put to the test when asked to evaluate a hovercraft from a Bond film, and an unusual painting of Saddam Hussein causes a stir in the office. Also, there's a big surprise for a mother looking to sell some spectacular jewellery to help her son's business venture.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: David and Pam Rowe are searching for their dream retirement home, so Spanish Property Choice line three apartments up for them to see within their 110,000 euro budget.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Warrington, where he meets Pauline and Alan Jacks, who have been trying to sell their three-bedroom property. He soon realises potential buyers may have been deterred by the dated decor, cuddly toys, tapestries and dolls dotted around the place. A few miles away, Colin Brunold has been hoping his four-bedroom family home would sell itself, but a dodgy chimney could be putting off house-hunters.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Businesswoman Karen would like to invest in a property and has a flexible budget of £280,000. Karen is torn: her heart is pulling her towards a new life abroad, but her adult daughter Danielle wishes her to remain in Britain. While Jasmine Harman finds her some tempting offers in Chamonix in the French Alps, Jonnie Irwin shows her the trendy east side of London.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, married couple Karen and Nigel kick off the competition with a Bajan-themed menu, followed by Beth and Clem's meal, and Jo and Charlie's Greek night.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Sheffield, with Ray and Chloe, Andrew and Claire, and Rob and Emma all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a mother-and-son team who have gone through 20 chefs in two years at their struggling Italian restaurant in California. The adjoining bar is a triumph, but the oldest dining establishment in town needs an overhaul if the inexperienced owners are to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits some of the restaurants that he set out to save, including The Mixing Bowl, The Olde Stone Mill, Peter's and Campania. Have their owners pulled themselves out of their nightmares?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south-west London to help another two couples find their dream home. Long-distance partners Jason and Jaye are looking for a one-bed pad with outside space in Clapham or Brixton to finally bring them together, while Hannah and Frank want a family home before they get married - but have viewed nearly 50 properties without finding the one they want.(n)

programme.title: Warship
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the Royal Navy's HMS Ocean on a seven-month active deployment, policing some of the most volatile waters on the planet and co-ordinating the fight against Isis. In this first edition, HMS Ocean leaves Plymouth for the Mediterranean, where the Tailored Air Group of elite armed forces helicopter pilots have just three weeks to learn how to take off and land on a carrier, but engine problems and the approach of a huge storm mean the new recruits and the old hands must pull together to succeed.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues her pursuit of the world's wealthiest people, meeting a man who got rich from caravan parks, a motivational speaker who made money helping others, and a man who can gold plate anything to order.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Trumps: From Immigrant to President
programme.desc: Donald Trump is the 45th President of the United States and commander in chief of America's armed forces, the most powerful position in the world. This documentary goes back to his roots, to reveal the story of his family. It reveals how Trump's penniless German grandfather arrived in America in the 1880s, and ended up running bars and brothels in the gold rush. And how his Scottish mother travelled from the Outer Hebrides to New York and worked as a maid before marrying Donald's tycoon father.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Platt, the President and CEO of entertainment and fitness business Sky Zone, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win an action-adventure holiday. He aims to discover whether his fast-growing company is running as smoothly and efficiently as possible, but his secret identity is jeopardised when he encounters a colleague he has met on a previous occasion.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of 37-year-old Angelo Mastropietro, as he transforms a damp, dark and abandoned cave in Worcestershire. Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st century caveman. He has a budget of £100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Food
programme.desc: Kiran Jethwa visits the Iban people of Borneo, where he goes on a wild boar hunt in the jungle and joins villagers on a search for edible frogs along the banks of a river.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her children's private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. Plus, a valuation doesn't come easy to the experts when a client turns up with a 7ft Terminator model.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple search for a home big enough for them and their eight children in Alicante, and the agency takes on a huge property that includes a luxurious cat hotel in the basement.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert transforms a cottage in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, with dated decor, a bare kitchen and a garden that resembles a jungle.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north east of England compete for the £1,000 prize - first up are loved-up musicians Nick and Kelly, followed by Matthew and Katie, and Michael and Becky.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north London, recently engaged couple Anita and Cash, laughter-loving Keith and his wife Maz, and foodies Dan and Les compete for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. Gordon finds owner Tina's work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present buildings in the Early category - those constructed between the 13th and 16th centuries. Those in the running are Hampton Court Palace, the Royal Hospital in Chelsea, a medieval building in Ledbury, and Hardwick Hall in Derbyshire, where the previously derelict stable block and barns have been revitalised for modern use. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Mr Parsons the chameleon meets a new partner, Daphne from Paris. Jaguars Napo and Goshi are being encouraged to mate, but Napo doesn't seem to be romantically inclined. Meanwhile, young giraffe Murchison faces the great outdoors for the first time, and another baby elephant is born, less than a month after the last new arrival.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Billy is rushed to St George's after being crushed by falling bricks that were being stored on his front drive, while six-year-old Luther has a metal washer stuck on his finger. Senior healthcare play specialist Tracy talks about her job, which is to comfort and distract children during their treatment in A&E, and 83-year-old Audrey arrives with her grandson Lee after damaging her wrist while falling on holiday.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants

programme.title: Five Children and It
programme.desc: Five brothers and sisters are sent to live with their uncle in the country during the First World War. programme.desc: Zac cannot bring himself to confess to Leah and also manages to alienate Sam, while Evelyn has a decision to make after Matt finds the letter offering her a post in Vietnam.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: A huge fight between the dance moms turns Kelly's birthday party into a disaster. Leslie returns and proves she will do anything to get her daughter a solo.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: People struggling to live on the dole while also caring for their furry friends, including 33-year-old Sheffield woman Billie, who claims more than £5,000 a year and shares her one-bedroom council home with an astonishing 32 pets. Rugby husband and wife Kim and Gary claim £900 credit per month, but with debts of at least £2,000, they face the heart-breaking choice of losing either their home or some of their five pets. And depression-sufferer Paul prefers animals to people, finding comfort in caring for his 24 pets. He receive disability and employment support, but has been battling for some time to prove he is entitled to his benefits.(n)

programme.title: Emerald City
programme.desc: War breaks out in the kingdom of Oz, and as the Wizard prepares to launch an attack on Glinda's army of witches, Dorothy chooses to confront him.(n)

programme.title: Sex Pod
programme.desc: Two young men want to learn more about foreplay and how to spice things up in the bedroom, and elsewhere a young woman learns how to put on a condom correctly.(n)

programme.title: One Night With My Ex
programme.desc: Another three ex-couples spend a night alone together, featuring young parents Scott and Laura, who ended their relationship after Scott's infidelity left Laura unable to trust him. Plus, couple Chloe and Christian who broke up at university try to make amends, and Sophie and Luke spend the night together after two years apart.(n)

programme.title: Godsend
programme.desc: Drama about a couple who make the decision to have their eight-year-old son cloned following his death in a tragic accident. Under the supervision of an expert in stem cell research, their son is illegally cloned, leading to a bizarre series of events(n)

programme.title: Presumed Innocent
programme.desc: A hard-charging prosecutor in a loveless marriage is accused of murdering a colleague with whom he had an affair after she turns up dead and all evidence points to him as the killer(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: When a young warrior fails to die from a fatal wound he's banished in the highlands of sixteenth-century Scotland. He soon learns though that he is part of an immortal race. Centuries later in New York he must fight his ultimate enemy to become the last of his kind(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn(n)

programme.title: Gung Ho
programme.desc: Ron Howard's comedy of manners about a Japanese company that takes over a Pennsylvania auto plant(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: Emotional docudrama about terminally ill New Jersey police officer Laurel Hester, whose 2005 legal battle for the right to pass her pension benefits on to her female life partner became an equal-rights milestone(n)

programme.title: The Great Outdoors
programme.desc: Comedy about what happens when an unannounced, uninvited and unwelcome family of misfits converges upon a lakeside resort to join their relatives for a summer of relaxation(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: H.G. Bissinger's best-selling true-life account of a few months in the life of a high-school football team comes to the screen in this adaptation written and directed by Peter Berg. Odessa, TX, is an oil town in the western part of the state that's home to the Permian High School Panthers, the football team with the best winning record in the state. Odessa is a town with more than its share of problems; the decline of the oil business in Texas has set the city's economy into a tailspin, and racial tensions still erupt into violence on occasion. But football is the one thing that brings all the people of Odessa together, and on Friday nights every fall, as many as 20,000 people fill Permian's football stadium to watch Coach Gary Gaines (Billy Bob Thornton) and his boys try to lead the team to victory. As Gaines works to build a winning team in a town where victory is prized above all else, however, his players struggle through the emotional trials common to any teenager and ponder the fact that there is little future in their hometown...and that a championship season can be as much a burden as a triumph. Friday Night Lights also stars Lucas Black, Derek Luke, Jay Hernandez, and country singer-turned-actor Tim McGraw(n)

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Robert Redford and Helen Mirren shine in this suspenseful thriller about a wealthy couple torn apart when the husband is kidnapped by a disgruntled former employee (Willem Dafoe). The millionaire's abduction sets off a nationwide FBI manhunt. Alessandro Nivola, Matt Craven, Melissa Sagemiller, Wendy Crewson(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: A paralysed forensics expert teams up with a fresh-faced cop to hunt down a serial killer. Thriller(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Meg Altman buys an old brownstone apartment fitted with a 'panic room', a secret, state-of-the-art chamber to hide from burglars. She never thought she'd need it, until she heard the glass break downstairs... Stylish, suspense thriller(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Luke Wilson, Vince Vaughn and Will Ferrell star in this raucous comedy reminiscent of "Animal House." They play three disillusioned men who decide to start a fraternity near their old college in an effort to recapture their youth(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Kicked out of a successful metal group 20 years previously, Robert 'Fish' Fishman gets a second chance at fame when he joins his nephew's band(n)

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.desc: Angell and Danny's search for the murderer of a security guard puts them on the trail of a master thief (guest star Nelly Furtado), who targets high-end department stores. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. The agents believe his erratic behaviour indicates post-traumatic stress disorder and try to calmly talk him round before restraining him. However, blood tests reveal high levels of steroids in his system - meaning someone is using him as a human lab rat. Starring Lauren Holly, Sean Murray and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A pizza delivery man is murdered, causing trouble when the two suspects point the finger at the other. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Investigations into a stolen credit card lead Briscoe and Curtis to a pair of teenage lovers who may have killed their newborn son and disposed of the body. The couple strenuously deny any wrongdoing - but the discovery of a decomposing baby's finger adds weight to the evidence against them. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.desc: Calleigh's car is run off the road and into a canal while she is en route back to the lab - and although she is unhurt, vital evidence is compromised, jeopardising an investigation into a rogue biker gang. Realising the entire case is at risk, Horatio and the team try to find new leads to solve it. Forensic drama, starring Emily Procter and David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine is seemingly killed in a mortar attack on America's heavily fortified administrative HQ in Baghdad, but a subsequent autopsy reveals he was murdered. Intelligence analyst Nikki Jardine volunteers to help Tony investigate the case - but her behaviour in Iraq makes him suspect she had an ulterior motive for requesting the assignment.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A dramatic undercover operation results in the death of a serial killer, seemingly bringing the case to an abrupt conclusion. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Voight and Antonio are called to a murder scene to examine the body of a woman who has had one of her ears severed, a calling card trait associated with a known serial rapist in New York. News arrives of another attack - but this time the victim has survived. Meanwhile, Halstead agrees to pose as Lindsay's fiance at a high school reunion, but the couple fail to make it to the event and end up spending an intimate night in a bar. Crossover episode with Law & Order: Special Victims Unit, starring Jason Baghe, Jon Seda, Ice-T and Kelli Giddish.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson's estranged half-brother shows up in New York asking for her help because Child Services is threatening to take his children away from him. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.desc: A prisoner transfer goes awry and a notorious paedophile escapes from custody. The team members face a race against the clock when he kidnaps another girl, and eventually track him down to a hotel - only to discover the victim has been taped to an explosive device. Elsewhere, Chris's family obligations lead him to contemplate joining another division. Crime drama, starring Missy Peregrym and Travis Milne. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A daredevil driver is decapitated while performing a stunt at a street party, bringing the festivities to a premature end. Realising the incident was murder rather than an accident, the team focuses the investigation on a bystander whose expertise with remote-controlled cars makes him a likely suspect. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A DNA assessment of a kidnapping crime scene reveals horrifying results for Natalia, who discovers her sister Anya is one of a number of missing women. programme.desc: The Chicago Fire spin-off returns for a second series. Meanwhile, Jay receives a package containing a flash drive that identifies the killer. Starring Jason Beghe and Jon Seda.(n)

programme.desc: Bridesmaids Revisited. The air is thick enough to cut with a knife in the offices of the Yale Daily News; though Rory (Alexis Bledel) is now editor, her predecessor Paris (Liza Weil) is still on the staff, and still seething with resentment. Nor is this Rory's only cross to bear: while attending the wedding of Logan's sister Honor (Devon Sorvari), Rory learns from each one of the bridesmaids that Logan (Matt Czuchry) was far from lonely -- or celibate -- during their brief separation. Back in Stars Hollow, Lorelai (Lauren Graham) babysits for Christopher's three-year-old daughter, Gigi (Nicolette Collier), who turns out to be a thoroughly out-of-control brat; and Zach (Todd Lowe) tries to reunite the band even as Lane (Keiko Agena) advertises for new members(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Punchy Cowpunchers. Everybody is a comic in this Three Stooges picture. The killer Dillon clan are shooting up a Western town and Nell (Christine McIntyre) sends her handsome, but clumsy oaf of a sweetheart, Elmer, off to get help. Help comes in the form of the Stooges, who are playing a trio of cavalrymen so incompetent that their frustrated sergeant sends them on the mission only because he believes they won't return alive. The boys dress up as desperadoes and enter the town's saloon, doing their best to appear tough. While ordering drinks, Shemp asks for a milkshake "made with sour milk!" Their lack of prowess in all things Western is immediately apparent, and on top of that, the gang's leader (Kenneth MacDonald) figures out they are spies. The Stooges attempt a different kind of disguise. This time they're waiters, but their fake mustaches give them away in almost record time. Eventually they do emerge victorious over the bad guys, but it's only with Nell's help (she's upstairs, cold-cocking every bad guy who has the misfortune to enter her room), and Shemp's winning battle with two of the bad men and a stick of dynamite. Elmer shows up eventually and when he tells Nell that cowboys don't settle down, she beans him with a piece of crockery. This knocks some sense into him, ending the picture on something of a romantic note(n)

programme.title: The Fugitive
programme.desc: This 1993 box-office smash partly adheres to the 1960s TV series on which it is based and partly goes off on several tangents of its own. Harrison Ford stars as Dr. Richard Kimble, convicted of murdering his wife. While being transferred to prison by bus, Kimble is involved in a spectacular bus-train collision (one of the best of its kind ever filmed). Surviving the disaster, Kimble escapes, vowing to track down the elusive professional criminal whom he holds responsible for the murder. Dogging the fugitive every foot of the way is U.S. marshal Sam Gerard (an Oscar-winning turn by Tommy Lee Jones), who announces his intention to search "every whorehouse, doghouse, and outhouse" to bring Kimble to justice. Unlike his dour TV-series counterpart Barry Morse, Jones plays the role with a sardonic sense of humor: when a cornered Kimble screams, "I didn't kill my wife," Gerard shrugs and famously replies, "I don't care." Once the premise has been established, scripters Jeb Stuart and David Twohy and director Andrew Davis pull off several audacious plot twists, ranging from Kimble's rendezvous with a sympathetic lab technician to a jaw-dropping dive into a huge waterfall. The second half of the film offers one surprise after another (including the true identity of the murderer), brilliantly avoiding the letdown that plagues many movie adaptations of old TV series(n)

programme.desc: Hoi Polloi. In one of their best Columbia shorts, The Three Stooges get involved with a professor (Harry Holmes) who wagers that he can transform the nitwits, Pygmalion-like, into refined gentleman. Written by the genial Felix Adler and directed with vim and vigor by the team's usual pilot, del Lord, Hoi Polloi is typical Stooges mayhem. In the supporting cast, Laurel & Hardy veteran Blanche Payson and Jean Harlow's stand-in Mary Dees joined such Stooges regulars as Geneva Mitchell, Phyllis Crane, Grace Goodall and Robert Graves. Hoi Polloi was remade by the Stooges in 1947 as Half Wits Holiday and again in 1958, as Pies and Guys(n)

programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

Meanwhile, E prepares for the birth of his child, Johnny Drama seeks a breakout role and Turtle tries to woo MMA fighter Ronda Rousey. Based on the HBO series(n)

programme.desc: A woman runs into her ex-fiancé, Rick, believed to be dead for 15 years. Rick has actually been in witness protection, and now that his cover is blown, the two must outrun vengeful criminals and corrupt agents(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex. Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.desc: In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. Scientists have received a message from space which details the DNA structure of the alien race which has sent it, together with instructions on how to combine the alien DNA with that of a human being. Now an experiment is underway to do just this - until the little girl at the heart of the experiment breaks out of the laboratory and goes on the run. Growing up at an incredible speed, Sil is also developing some quite alien powers and presents a serious threat to the human population. A team of trackers - and assassins - has been despatched to eliminate her, but will they succeed before it is too late?(n)

programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Action drama in which Dirty' Harry Callahan returns to investigate an underground betting ring in which the participants gamble on the deaths of prominent San Francisco citizens. One such dead pool' list contains the names of a rock star, a film critic and a talk-show host, all of whom have been systematically murdered. As Callahan looks further into the murders, he finds another well-known name on the list - his own(n)

programme.desc: Hitler's Dangerous Car Journeys. Hitler endangers himself following campaigns in Poland and France(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard

programme.desc: Rangers Lead the Way. A look at the U.S. Army Rangers' D-Day mission to storm the cliffs at Pointe de Hoc and knock out the German guns that threatened the Allied invasion in June 1944(n)

programme.title: WWII's Greatest Raids
programme.desc: Hitler's Last Bridge. Recalling the capture of Germany's Ludendorff Bridge by American forces on March 7, 1945, after Nazi engineers bungled attempts to blow it up(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: A New Germany (1933-1939). This video is volume one in the 26-volume World at War series that chronicles the history of World War II. Originally appearing on television in 1974, the popular show was hosted by Laurence Olivier. In this first episode, the producers show the terrible cost of the war -- worldwide devastation and the deaths of 55 million people. The program examines the politics and economy of Germany that brought forth the Nazi Party and the leadership of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Distant War (September 1939 - May 1940). While the full force of the Nazi war machine sweeps across Europe, an uneasy calm settles on Britain(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: France Falls (May - June 1940). Spring 1940: France falls under German attack. On film: the Maginot line, where the French wait while German Panzer divisions advance through the unprotected Ardennes forest. Parachutists invade neutral Holland, Rommel defeats the French at Sedan and the German war machine moves on to Paris. At Dunkirk, Allied troops are evacuated. Belgium capitulates. The Franco-German Armistice is signed at Compiegne. Laurence Olivier is the host(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Alone (May 1940 - May 1941). May 1940: troops are evacuated from Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain begins. Churchill makes his famous "finest hour" speech and Britain prepares. Newsreel films show dogfights over Dover, the bombing of London, rescue work and royal tours of blitzed areas. The House of Commons is hit and Germany invades the USSR. Narrator: Laurence Olivier(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Barbarossa (June - December 1941). Hitler turns his tanks towards Russia. After a succession of victories, the Germans delay fatally(n)

programme.title: Wild Russia
programme.desc: Arctic. Exploring the fragile and harsh conditions of Russia's portion of the Arctic Circle, home to polar bears and snowy owls that manage to survive in extreme conditions(n)

programme.title: Wild Russia
programme.desc: Urals. Travel through the majestic Primeval forests of the Urals. This Russian sanctuary is a land of extremes where giant deer, half-tonne leviathans and tiny adventures flourish. Eurasian elk make seasonal journeys in search of food. Unlike other deer, Eurasian elk are normally solitary and for pregnant females, the stress of meeting leads to fighting. The elk migration leads them across swollen, fast-moving rivers and while they are strong swimmers, many are lost in the treacherous journey. After many months of hibernating, it's a rude awakening for the hungry brown bear who searches for an easy kill. As the snow retreats, opportunists like lone wolves advance to feed on winter's victims. The unique Russian desman, a semi-aquatic and almost-blind relative of the mole, has scent glands at the base of its tail that gives it a musky, unappetizing smell to discourage predators(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Spy in the IRA - Panorama.
programme.desc: The story behind one of Britain's most important spies since the Second World War. Code-named Stakeknife, Freddie Scappaticci worked for the IRA for decades, in charge of rooting out and executing suspected informers - but he was also spying for the British security services. Scappaticci denies the allegations, but is now the subject of a £35million criminal inquiry. Reporter John Ware investigates how Stakeknife operated, why his crimes were ignored and why he has been protected for so long.(n)

programme.title: No Strings Attached

But despite their best efforts, they start to fall in love. Romantic comedy, starring Natalie Portman, Ashton Kutcher, Kevin Kline and Cary Elwes.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary charting the development of 25 children born at the start of the millennium returns to follow the participants as they turn 16. Robert Winston and Tanya Byron discover how the teenagers' changing brains means that what they choose to do at this age can shape their lives forever, and explore research in human biology and neuroscience that reveals how the most baffling aspects of this stage of life can be explained and illuminated by the latest understanding of the changing teenage brain.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Puerto Rico - Island of Enchantment: Natural World.
programme.desc: After being colonised by humans, Puerto Rico's rich natural resources were rapidly exploited for agriculture, industry and urban development - leading to 95 per cent of all its rainforests being lost. This documentary follows a conservation team fighting to save the most endangered creatures from extinction after they have been pushed to the edge of existence by human encroachment. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Food writer Mary Berry is one of Britain's best-loved TV cooks, finding fame thanks to her judging role on The Great British Bake Off. A self-confessed go-getter, she wants to trace her family tree to know where she gets her energy and drive from. The journey begins in Bath, where Mary grew up, and takes her to Norwich, where both her grandparents lived. Along the way she uncovers ancestors including a bankrupt book-binder, a self-motivated corset-maker and a third who worked in a much more familiar profession.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Bailey narrates a documentary examining the lives of an eccentric cast of unconventional and unusual creatures that do things differently, turning this oddness to their advantage, such as the parrot that has forgotten how to fly, the bear that has turned vegetarian and a penguin that lives in the forest.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough: 60 Years in the Wild
programme.desc: David Attenborough reflects on his TV career, charting changes in the natural world and mankind's understanding of the planet as well as developments in wildlife film-making. In the first episode, he looks back on the animal encounters that have shaped his career - from the early black-and-white Zoo Quest days to a close encounter with a lion pride in the pitch dark. He also shares a few tricks of the trade, such as how to catch a Komodo dragon and the secret to maintaining continuity in the most difficult circumstances, and recalls the making of landmark series Life on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and James Braxton embark on a new road trip, beginning in Boston, Lincolnshire, before ending at their first auction in the Norfolk town of Fakenham.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: Santa Fe, New Mexico, to the Grand Canyon.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through New Mexico, watching rehearsals at the Santa Fe Opera House and learning about a Lancashire railroad caterer who made his fortune. He then sets off from Albuquerque to pick up Arizona's Grand Canyon Railway as heads off to witness one of the greatest sights on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton hosts the second heat, and judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden want more miniatures - 36 uniform eclairs and 36 identical Mont Blancs. For their Showpiece the teams are tasked with a Gateau de Mariage. When the final points are tallied, one team will have to leave.(n)

programme.title: Obesity: How Prejudiced Is the NHS
programme.desc: Professor Rachel Batterham, head of the obesity services at University College Hospital , examines the medical cost of obesity that is threatening to bankrupt the NHS. She explores whether there is 'fat prejudice' against obese patients within parts of the service that is stopping them accessing a potentially cost effective surgery, even when recent scientific research supports it.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: New series. The 50th season gets under way from Maidstone in Kent with performances by Leicester's Kasabian, UK electro-duo Alison and Will, better known as Goldfrapp. The acclaimed pianist also welcomes the Los Angeles bass player Thundercat, West Coast-based Anderson .Paak & The Free Nationals, Austin, Texas rock band Spoon and Phoenix-born singer songwriter Courtney Marie Andrews.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Alone with the In-Laws
programme.desc: Chris and Stacey from Bristol are getting married in the summer, and while planning for the big day is one thing, making a success of the years that follow is another. To help out, the Rev Kate Bottley comes up with an idea - they will spend a few days living alone with their respective in-laws-to-be, to find out what they can learn about each other from the people who raised them. After four days, will the couple still feel the same about trying the knot?.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: With Louis laid low by a major fever, those conspiring against him continue to grow in strength and confidence. Meanwhile, Philippe is caught in the middle, and so are medic Masson and his daughter Claudine. The period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of King Louis XIV continues. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts, with Professor Kate Williams and Greg Jenner. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Amira Casar and Evan Williams.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace return to put 64 more amateur cooks to the test. The first eight hopefuls begin by creating a dish using ingredients chosen from the new 'MasterChef market', stocked full of produce from all over the world, including pork mince, halibut and pancetta. Only five contestants will survive the first round, and the remaining cooks are then challenged to prepare a two-course meal to secure a place in the quarter-final. The amateurs not only have to impress John and Gregg, but also the finalists of last year's MasterChef competition.(n)

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The home potters are tested on the art of Japanese-style ceramics. For the main challenge, they throw a sake set, consisting of one bottle and six identical cups. The exciting part, however, comes during the firing, when they use a risky 16th-century method in which they pull their burning pieces out of the kiln and plunge them into a bin full of combustible materials. For the spot test, they must pierce and carve an intricate design into a lantern using a technique known as the `devil's work', and the throw down sees them back at the wheel, making as many rice bowls as they can in 15 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for Dinner
programme.sub-title: Further Back in Time for Dinner.
programme.desc: The family reflect on their time travels, discovering that much of what they experienced in the past, still lives on around our dinner tables today. Polly Russell shows them the delights of a contemporary canned meal, and Brandon and Rochelle sample a Peruvian dinner with co-presenter Giles Coren. Finally the Robshaws share a celebratory meal with Giles and Polly as they realise how many of our historical eating habits are still a treasured part of modern family mealtimes. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team examines the impact of associations with famous people on the value of antiques and collectibles, with presenter Paul Martin discovering just how much the signatures of the Beatles are worth.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence makes a suspicious discovery during the eviction of a group of squatters, while Tommy and Craig go looking for a steel company boss who owes money.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A pair of yellow deck chair frames, a wooden vice and a sideboard are the items rescued in Surrey and transformed by Sarah Moore and her team.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer and former Great British Bake Off judge continues to celebrate the everyday food and ingredients she has always loved, from hearty and wholesome ideas to easy-to-make crowd-pleasers and family classics. In this edition, Mary focuses on food that exemplifies indulgence, demonstrating mouth-watering dishes that give the mundane a lift with lashings of naughtiness. Treats are in store as she investigates the history of the British pie and reveals the secrets to making an easy sticky toffee pudding.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.sub-title: From Berneray to Pabbay: The Riddle of the Sands.
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to explore more of the remote and fascinating places that lie off the mainland, beginning with a cluster of islands in the Outer Hebrides. He starts his journey just off the coast of North Uist at Berneray, then heads south to Grimsay and Kirkibost, before ending on the deserted whisky island of Pabbay.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces action from the opening day at the Hong Kong Velodrome, featuring the finals of the men's and women's team sprints, and the women's scratch race.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Inspector George Gently and The Professionals star Martin Shaw is the latest celebrity to go in search of his roots, and he's particularly interested in finding out more about his paternal grandfather Edwin, who was rarely spoken about by his family. The actor has only one photo of his ancestor, which shows him aged roughly 17 and wearing a military uniform. By zooming in on the picture, Martin's brother was able to identify their grandfather's badge, which suggests he was in the Royal Marines. Now, by meeting with a military historian, Martin tries to fill in the rest of the story, and in the process learns more about Edwin's role in defending Birmingham against German air assaults during the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Leonora is a 16-year-old orangutan who has been living in a commune on a protected island run by the Borneo Orangutan Survival Foundation. This documentary follows Leonora and her three-year-old infant Lemar as they undertake an epic and life-changing journey by boat, road and finally helicopter, before being released into the rainforest.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough: 60 Years in the Wild
programme.desc: David Attenborough reflects on scientific discoveries in his lifetime that have transformed the way the natural world is viewed - including evidence of how and where life began, the ways in which continents move, and research into animal communication and behaviour. He also recalls some of his more hair-raising attempts to bring new science to a television audience, and clips show him standing in the shadow of an erupting volcano and being charged at by a group of armed New Guinea tribesmen.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneer Charlie Ross and James Braxton start in the Lincolnshire town of Stamford, then travel around Norfolk before ending up at an auction in St Ives, Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore an Cornish museum sign, an old banger boat, and Julie and Amanda repair a special teddy bear who has lost one of his eyes.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Minneapolis and St Paul, where he learns how the power of the Mississippi helped Minneapolis become a great industrial centre. Later in St Paul, he explores the birthplace of F Scott Fitzgerald, and meets with a Native American expert to discover more about a dark chapter in American history.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: Chris Packham hosts the show where dog owners and their pets compete in a series of unique challenges to test the levels of trust between man and dog. This time, the Red team have the first chance to score points in a paddle-boarding challenge in Lake Windermere, while the Yellow team take on a series of canine woodland obstacle courses. Finally, the teams take part in a challenging cross-country race, where the owners and their pets are tethered together, hoping to triumph in the second stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: The group begin to settle into rural living after their first week living in Tuscany, but a storm forces them to race against time to complete the ambitious Sangiovese grape harvest, and rescue the farm's biggest income. Meanwhile, the group members look to expand the farm's potential with a new Bed and Breakfast venture, and begin to renovate an empty out-building. However, as the first guests start to arrive, all does not go according to plan, and temperamental Tuscan plumbing puts a spanner in the works for their grand ambitions.(n)

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: New series. The presenter takes to the streets of Cwmbran to learn the business of selling houses. Gavin, Rhod's mentor, believes happy people sell, placing extra pressure on the grumpy comedian. Can Rhod's unique approach cope with the high-octane sales environment and make him employee of the month, or will he have the home buyers running scared?.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Obesity: How Prejudiced Is the NHS
programme.desc: Professor Rachel Batterham, head of the obesity services at University College Hospital , examines the medical cost of obesity that is threatening to bankrupt the NHS. She explores whether there is 'fat prejudice' against obese patients within parts of the service that is stopping them accessing a potentially cost effective surgery, even when recent scientific research supports it.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford tells the story of how Dr Henry Gray and Dr Henry Carter produced academic textbook Gray's Anatomy - the world's most famous study of the human body. Based on dissections they performed themselves, the accuracy of its descriptions and the stark beauty of its illustrations made it an instant bestseller. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: After months trapped in a port in northern France, the winds finally change and Duke William leads his vast invasion fleet across the Channel. Catastrophically, King Harold is 300 miles away in the north, having defeated the Vikings. Harold rushes back south, gathers a new army, and heads to Hastings to take on this new invasion. The two armies will meet at Battle in Sussex on 14 October, 1066, and the outcome will change the shape of England and Europe forever. Dan Snow presents. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Big Think
programme.sub-title: Should We Go to Mars? The Big Think.
programme.desc: Dr Kevin Fong, who has a diverse background in astrophysics, aeronautics and medicine, offers a guide through the ethical, technical and scientific challenges of attempting to send astronauts to Mars. Costing billions of dollars, and the lives of those brave enough to attempt it, Kevin asks if the possible benefits are really worth the risk?.(n)

programme.title: The Beginning and End of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili unravels the cosmic mystery of science's creation story, recreating key experiments to tackle the greatest question in science, beginning with how the universe came into being.(n)

programme.title: Ray Mears Goes Walkabout
programme.desc: The survival expert sets out to cross Australia, tracing the journey of John McDouall Stuart, the first European to travel on foot from south to north through the country's deserts. Demonstrating the importance of travelling light, Ray needs to squeeze every drop of moisture out of his surroundings to make it to his destination.(n)

programme.title: Servants: The True Story of Life Below Stairs
programme.desc: Pamela Cox unearths tales of servant rebellion during the Edwardian era, including butlers selling stories to the press and maids joining the suffragette movement, as employees began to question the merits of a life spent in service. She also examines how people who would traditionally have become domestic staff started to find more attractive forms of employment in shops and factories, leading middle-class households to search for workers in slums and reform schools.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: The Mating Game - Natural World Special.
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates a look at the different methods animals use to attract a mate, revealing how inventive, loving and complex they can be. A female polar bear tries to revive a male's interest in her by turning cartwheels in front of him, while a bird of paradise tidies obsessively as he prepares a stage for his dance. While other lemurs are fighting for the right to breed, one sidles up to a female and wins favour by wafting his scent at her, and silverback gorilla seduction involves staring with a fixed grin.(n)

programme.title: How To Be A Surrealist with Philippa Perry
programme.desc: Psychotherapist Philippa Perry discovers the roots of Surrealism established in the political upheavals of 1920s Europe, and examines new ways of understanding the human psyche.(n)

programme.title: The Big Think
programme.sub-title: Should We Go to Mars? The Big Think.
programme.desc: Dr Kevin Fong, who has a diverse background in astrophysics, aeronautics and medicine, offers a guide through the ethical, technical and scientific challenges of attempting to send astronauts to Mars. Costing billions of dollars, and the lives of those brave enough to attempt it, Kevin asks if the possible benefits are really worth the risk?.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Into the Wind
programme.desc: Writer and birdwatcher Tim Dee walks along the vast open flatlands of the Lincolnshire Wash, on a quest to capture the elusive sound of 'pure' wind. On his travels, he reflects on the landscape, walking, writing, birds and wind. From documentary film maker Richard Alwyn.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Wonderlands: Islands of Evolution
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Richard Fortey investigates why islands are natural laboratories of evolution and examines the unique and remarkable species that live on them. He begins by heading to Hawaii to investigate how life colonises a newly formed island, and encounters honeycreeper birds whose development rivals that of Darwin's famous finches, as well as carnivorous caterpillars that now cannot eat leaves, and giant silversword plants that thrive in parched volcanic soil at heights of 10,000ft.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Conservationist Rom Whitaker discovered a leopard had moved on to his farm near Chennai and decided to investigate India's complex relationship with the big cats and find out why hundreds of the animals are being stoned, trapped or shot. He examines why such a large predator is still relatively common in a country of 1.2 billion people and explores the reasons behind some leopards becoming man-eaters.(n)

programme.title: Dust Storm
programme.desc: Documentary about the dangerous weather phenomena. The programme explores the Middle east, the part of the world most heavily affected by dust storms, and questions what causes them, the damage they can cause to people's health and how they can be prevented.(n)

programme.title: The Big Think
programme.sub-title: Should We Go to Mars? The Big Think.
programme.desc: Dr Kevin Fong, who has a diverse background in astrophysics, aeronautics and medicine, offers a guide through the ethical, technical and scientific challenges of attempting to send astronauts to Mars. Costing billions of dollars, and the lives of those brave enough to attempt it, Kevin asks if the possible benefits are really worth the risk?.(n)

programme.title: Sappho: Love & Life on Lesbos with Margaret Mountford
programme.desc: Documentary following Alan Sugar's former Apprentice adviser as she searches for the truth behind the legend of Sappho, the most controversial writer of the ancient world and the first authentic woman's voice in Western history. The discovery of a lost papyrus containing the words to songs that had not been heard for 1,700 years sends Margaret on a journey of exploration to learn more about the poet whose erotic writings created the words `sapphic' and `lesbian', named after the island of Lesbos - the place of her birth.(n)

programme.desc: Prince Iben Kostas plans to use his wealth to start a war, so the IMF team try to infiltrate his casino in a bid to stop him in his tracks. Martin Landau stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A spy satellite technician's voyeuristic activities inadvertently lead to him witnessing the murder of a Navy commander involved in an important weapons project. Tipped off by an anonymous call, the investigators arrive at the base to find the victim has been stabbed in the back. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sasha Alexander.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A severed leg bearing a marine tattoo is discovered in a rubbish bin. Once the victim is identified, Gibbs and the crew follow the trail back to a small town, where an insurance fraud seems to have taken place. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Sasha Alexander.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The marine son of a colonel-turned-preacher is found dead in woodlands after changing his religious persuasion. As the case unfolds, it becomes apparent to the agents that he could have been the victim of a hate crime. Meanwhile, Gibbs' father visits for the holidays. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Anna Kosovo, a friend of Ben Cartwright's, fears for her life when her husband becomes a raging lunatic and barricades both of them inside their home, threatening to kill anyone who tries to get inside.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: The lawman promises to track down the attackers who raped a friend's daughter. Adventure with the modern-day lawman whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West. Chuck Norris stars.(n)

programme.title: The Streets of San Francisco
programme.desc: Mike and Dan investigate two execution-style murders, but with no suspects, it is the ballistics work which prompts the pair to hunt for the lone killer responsible. Vintage American crime drama, starring Karl Malden as veteran detective Mike Stone.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy bargains galore.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team races to find a sniper who is targeting marine recruitment officers and picking them off one by one. The only clue is a white feather left at the scene of each shooting - and in the absence of any other evidence, Gibbs uses himself as bait to catch the killer. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sasha Alexander and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Three similar execution-style killings take place, and the team discovers one of the victims was going through a messy divorce. His widow falls under suspicion of committing the first two crimes to mask the murder of her husband - but, unfortunately for the agents, she has an alibi. Starring Michael Weatherly and David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Stewart is selected to be part of a group of men known as LA's most eligible bachelors, but is horrified to discover the chosen few are being systematically killed - and after examining puncture marks on the victims' necks, Sloan has to explore some unorthodox theories.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.sub-title: Gold Train: The Bullet - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of three. Bandits attack the train carrying Matt to Denver for medical treatment.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Joe and Hoss encounter trouble when they arrive in Agua Santos, New Mexico, with one of them breaking the law by removing his hat in church.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio, Calleigh and Speedle investigate the murder of an exotic dancer at a party, but have trouble finding a motive. Meanwhile, fellow officers Eric and Megan are mystified by the death of a diver. Crime drama, starring David Caruso, Kim Delaney and Rory Cochrane.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Sam and the team spring into action when fellow agent Dom activates a distress signal. They track down his car, which is riddled with bullet holes, and Eric intercepts a signal from his phone, tracing it to a house that contains nothing but some used medical supplies and a dead body. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Prince Iben Kostas plans to use his wealth to start a war, so the IMF team try to infiltrate his casino in a bid to stop him in his tracks. Martin Landau stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy pilot who was wearing an experimental jet pack is murdered in a secluded area, and the strange circumstances of the case lead the team into a confrontation with a no-nonsense attorney who appears to hold a grudge against Gibbs. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After a mid-series break, the drama following the exploits of the Los Angeles-based Office of Special Projects returns. Sam and Callen investigate when five men wearing US Marine uniforms are found dead in a warehouse and discover they were killed by a lethal toxin that could be used as a bioweapon. Initial inquiries lead them to a former military chemist who now has Alzheimer's, while Callen recognises one of the victims as someone who used to work as hired muscle for the well-connected owner of a strip joint. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and his team investigate the gruesome case of four family members found murdered in their home and initially suspect the mother is responsible - but subsequent evidence points to an entirely different conclusion. Crime drama, starring David Caruso and Kim Delaney.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 204. Mark Cuban tries to monopolize the action by urging entrepreneurs not to negotiate with the other sharks if they hope to do business with him. Male-oriented candles, a wedding innovation and an eco-friendly way to listen to music on the go are pitched(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 310. Mark Cuban, owner of 2011 NBA champions Dallas Mavericks, returns as Season 3 begins with a pitch from NBA Hall of Famer Bill Walton and triathlete Dave Meyer, who has designed a new water bottle. Other pitches include a celebrity ghostwriting business; an online funeral-planning venture; and a Web site that offers VIP access to nightlife activities around the U.S. Also: an update on a Season 2 customized-speakers venture(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 605. Entrepreneurs include the owner of an all-female golf caddy company; a couple who believe they have come up with a better, safer way for kids to bounce; and a trio who pitch to the Sharks their fun spin on a classic faceware accessory. Also: an update on Mark Cuban's $2 million investment in the Los Angeles Haunted Hayride during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 521. Mark Cuban gives a mechanical engineer from San Francisco a tongue-lashing; and parents from Los Angeles pitch babywear that's designed to help caregivers keep track of busy crawlers. Also: an invention that could revolutionize shoe shining; a Rochester man's idea for colorful modular laces; and an update on KaZAM balance bikes from Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 405. Dresses made from pillowcases is a concept that both Lori and Daymond are willing to fight over; a South Carolina woman gets laughs with her name for a special spatula; a father-and-son team from California demonstrate their vitamin oral sprays; and waffles that promise an energy boost are touted by a man from Marysville, Wash. Also: an update on a Season 2 mobile entertainment business run by two brothers who passed on Kevin's investment offer(n)

programme.title: The Deed: Chicago
programme.desc: Fires on Every Floor. programme.title: The Deed: Chicago

programme.desc: Episode 717. An undiagnosed condition drove a wedge between Sammy and her mum, when her bad behaviour was put down to teenage hormones, until a long-awaited diagnosis of endometriosis when she was 19 enabled them to build bridges.(n)

programme.desc: Chefs are known for being fiery and temperamental. But what happens when they walk out, leaving restaurants in the lurch? These days, desperate owners call the relief agency for an emergency chef, who must master unfamiliar menus, handle inexperienced staff and satisfy demanding owners and customers. Here, cameras follows three such chefs as they descend on a luxury London hotel, a Devon manor house and a busy Midlands pub.(n)

Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the Royal Navy's HMS Ocean on a seven-month active deployment, policing some of the most volatile waters on the planet and co-ordinating the fight against Isis. In this first edition, HMS Ocean leaves Plymouth for the Mediterranean, where the Tailored Air Group of elite armed forces helicopter pilots have just three weeks to learn how to take off and land on a carrier, but engine problems and the approach of a huge storm mean the new recruits and the old hands must pull together to succeed.(n)

Plus, in Southend, serial mover June's home is found to be bathed in an overbearing shade of pink.(n)

programme.title: FIA World Rally Championship Highlights
programme.desc: The Rally de France. Action from the fourth round of the season, which took place on tarmac roads on the island of Corsica. Home favourite Sebastien Ogier won the opening race of this campaign in Monte-Carlo, with Finland's Jari-Matti Latvala taking the honours in Sweden and Northern Irishman Kris Meeke winning round three in Mexico. Defending champion Ogier topped the standings after finishing on the podium in both of those subsequent races.(n)

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Cameras take a look inside the 11th-century church, partially designed by Christopher Wren. It has been the final resting place for 17 monarchs, played host to the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in 1953, and has hosted 16 royal weddings, including Prince William's marriage to Catherine Middleton in 2011.(n)

programme.title: A Year in the Wild
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire: A Year in the Wild: Winter.
programme.desc: Despite its delayed arrival, for the Grey Seals at Ravenscar Beach winter means it is time to give birth. The newborn pups are now on the fast track to adulthood, with just three weeks to gain as much weight as possible before their mothers move on. Cameras also follow the progress of many short-eared owls which land on the moors after the long flight over the north sea from northern Europe. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth II: Crown and Country
programme.desc: Documentary looking back at the Queen's reign, from her ascension to the throne in 1952, following the death of her father George VI, to her Diamond Jubilee celebrations. This updated version celebrates her becoming Britain's longest reigning monarch, and archive footage and interviews help tell the story of a monarch who has steered the royal family into a new millennium and beyond. She has overseen Britain's transformation into a multicultural nation, travelled farther than any other Queen in history, and shared the world stage with countless historic figures along the way.(n)

programme.title: Tony Robinson: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: The actor explores the Yorkshire Dales and in the town of Hawes, meets the team who came together to save local production of Wensleydale cheese by organising a management buy-out of the creamery after the parent company closed it down. Tony also visits the market town of Leyburn on calf auction day, before heading to Aysgarth Falls, a triple flight of waterfalls carved out of the River Ure. In the Swaledale valley, Tony joins in rehearsals of the Muker Silver Band, discovering the origins of this traditional brass outfit.(n)

programme.title: Spectacular Spain with Alex Polizzi
programme.desc: On the Costa Blanca, the presenter reveals how thriving port Valencia has much more to offer than just its sandy beaches. She samples horchata, a sweet drink made from tiger nuts and another local speciality - paella. She also visits the cathedral, where a small chapel houses an ancient chalice believed by some to be the Holy Grail. Further south is Benidorm, where Alex explores its transformation from a quiet fishing village to a high-rise holiday resort. Finally, she visits the tiny island of Tabarca, only a short boat trip away from the mainland but part of a very different world.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Broadway star Marc Landry falls to his death after his flying harness fails during a performance of a play based on the Greek myth of Icarus. Goren and Eames are called in when it becomes clear the rigging had been tampered with, and the detectives talk to director Amanda Rollins about the significance of a bouquet of flowers with peacock feathers delivered to the victim. Goren also pays a visit to old friend and mythology lecturer Cleo Andrews for expert advice. Guest starring Cynthia Nixon and Patti Smith.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Street Crime UK.
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces across the UK to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to fight the huge rise in street crime. In London, the Met's robbery squads work the streets on a busy Friday night, and with criminals now using motorbikes to get away, cameras help officers identify, track and apprehend offenders. Nick also finds out how pickpockets, scammers and bag thieves use sleight of hand and distraction to relieve people of their valuables.(n)
