programme.desc: Sonya wakes up feeling terrible after the night before, while Piper spots Brooke Butler while escorting Paige from a check-up.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Jody Ray is killed by a hit-and-run driver and evidence points to staff sergeant Justin Dunne, whose guilt seems certain when DiNozzo and McGee find him washing a bloodstained knife when they go to arrest him. However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka).(n)

programme.title: Deadly Daycare
programme.desc: A divorcee suspects nursery staff of mistreating her young daughter. When the girl's increasingly awkward behaviour arouses suspicion, the mother plants a hidden camera on the premises and discovers why the owner may hold a grudge against her. Thriller, starring Kayla Ewell, Christy Carlson Romano and Bryce Johnson. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya wakes up feeling terrible after the night before, while Piper spots Brooke Butler while escorting Paige from a check-up.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Billie's family and friends gather to give her an emotional send-off and VJ and Ash scatter her ashes in the ocean, while John is in despair at the damage his actions have caused.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Ancient Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Ancient Mysteries: Dead Sea Treasure Map.
programme.desc: In 1952, a team of archaeologists discovered what was to become known as the Copper Scroll in a cave high above the Dead Sea. It was classified as a Dead Sea Scroll, but was not regarded a treasure map rather than a biblical text - and the riches it listed are estimated to be worth $3billion. In this programme, experts travel to Israel, Egypt and Rome, attempting to solve the greatest treasure hunt ever set.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The doctors treat a series of patients with broken bones and open wounds, including a man involved in a motorcycle accident just three days earlier, and a woman with an abscess on her upper leg and groin. The doctors also deal with Gary, who underwent facial surgery to remove a cancerous tumour from his jaw.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents have an explosive run-in with a debtor as they try to retrieve £1,800 owed by a car dealership, and in Derbyshire, two officers try to collect more than £1,500 in unpaid parking fines. Elsewhere, Max and Paul are in London as they attempt to recover £2,000 owed by a property company, but an employee refuses to let them enter.(n)

programme.title: One Night With My Ex
programme.desc: Another three former couples spend 24 hours alone together to discuss their unfinished business. First, ex-fiances' Paul and Phil come together for an emotional reunion, after Paul left the relationship without saying a word. Next to meet up are ex-couple King and Daisy, whose fiery relationship broke down after suspicions of cheating, and Lauren and Blake, who broke up three years ago.(n)

programme.title: Gypsy Kids: Our Secret World
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Romany gypsy Ben has been bullied at school as long as he can remember. Not to be held back, he has dreams of becoming a pilot, and funds his £150 lessons himself by selling eggs to the local cafe. But can he obtain his qualifications with so many interruptions to his education? Four-year-old Rudy watches his dad, professional cage fighter Tony, for the first time, and Irish traveller friends Alivia and Alicia face eviction for the second time this year.(n)

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: In this hip crime drama, a spoiled rich teen's (Henry Thomas) sister is abducted, and he and his punk friends decide to kidnap an ex-mob boss (Christopher Walken) as a negotiating tool. But the wily mobster turns the tables on his bungling captors. Denis Leary, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Laura San Giacomo(n)

programme.title: Dead Presidents
programme.desc: It is 1972 when Anthony aged 22 returns from the marine corps to his neighbourhood, only to discover that he is not treated as a hero. Though for a while he manages a part time job in a butchers shop. Anthony with his girlfriend Juanita who bore his daughter shortly after he enlisted, is living in an infested South Bronx apartment barely making ends meet. Anthony feels he has no alternative but to take part in a scheme to obtain some "dead Presidents" - a slang term for cash: Anthony celebrates his combat knowledge to help plan the heist of an armoured car that carries out of circulation currency to be burned in Washington(n)

programme.title: The Glimmer Man
programme.desc: Action thriller about a government agent who is asked to resume his old role as a police officer to help catch a serial killer preying on the citizens of LA. Teamed with a local homicide detective, the agent discovers that the killer seems to know a lot about his past(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Three New York drag queens travel cross-country on their way to Hollywood, but a broken-down car strands them in a narrow-minded country town, where they share makeup tips with the ladies and show the hostile men how to treat women right(n)

programme.title: Riding in Cars With Boys
programme.desc: Funny and heartwarming tale of a teen mother struggling to raise her son and overcome the feeling that she has made the wrong choices in life(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: Combining influences from Tex Avery cartoons to Sam Raimi horror movies to 1940s B-movies, Joel Coen and Ethan Coen followed up the stylish film noir of their debut, Blood Simple (1984), with this frantic screwball comedy. H.I. "Hi" McDonnough (Nicholas Cage) is a philosophical but slightly dim career criminal who has been arrested so often that he gets to know "Ed," short for Edwina (Holly Hunter), the officer who takes his mug shots. Hi takes a shine to Ed and promises to go straight if she marries him. She accepts, and they move to the Arizona desert, where Hi holds down a factory job and blissfully watches the sunsets with Ed. Their serenity is shattered when the couple decides that they want a child and discover that, as Hi puts it, "Ed's womb was a rocky place where my seed could find no purchase." (One of the film's many delights is Hi's unexpectedly flowery dime-novel narration.) Ed goes into a severe depression until she sees an item in the news. Nathan Arizona (Trey Wilson), owner of a chain of unpainted furniture stores, has become the father of quintuplets, and he and his wife joke that they now have more children than they know what to do with. In what seems like a perfect "helps you, helps me" situation, Hi and Ed kidnap one of the Arizona infants, figuring that they'll have a baby and the Arizonas will have less of a burden(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: A mysterious wanderer looks for dry land after Earth is engulfed by water(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer, who dazzled as Jim Morrison in "The Doors" and Doc Holliday in "Tombstone," adds another outstanding real-life characterization to his résumé---John Holmes. This film chronicles the porn star's suspected involvement in a 1981 homicide that left four of his 'friends' dead. The first-rate supporting cast includes Lisa Kudrow, Eric Bogosian, Dylan McDermott and Ted Levine(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women in this sexy sequel(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: The self-styled sexiest spy in the world travels back to the 1960s after his nemesis steals his most treasured possession: his 'mojo'. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Two best friends become rivals when they schedule their respective weddings on the same day(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two aging friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on vacation together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona

In what seems like a perfect "helps you, helps me" situation, Hi and Ed kidnap one of the Arizona infants, figuring that they'll have a baby and the Arizonas will have less of a burden(n)

programme.title: Civil Brand
programme.desc: Charged, hard-hitting drama follows a new inmate (LisaRaye) as she fights to affect change at a women's penetentiary that is run as a prison-for-profit by abusive, corrupt officials. Hip-hop star Mos Def costars as a sympathetic jailer who tries to help the exploited yardbirds. Rappers Da Brat and MC Lyte are also featured. N'Bushe Wright, Monica Calhoun, Clifton Powell, Lark Voohies(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: A radio DJ stationed in a US base in Vietnam infuriates the brass with his own anarchic brand of humour(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Though chef Kate Armstrong's Type A personality serves her well when whipping up meals in the trendy Manhattan eatery where she has made a name for herself, it threatens to sink her when she is named as the guardian of her nine-year-old niece Zoe. To complicate matters, an impetuous new sous chef named Nick Palmer has recently joined the kitchen staff and his freewheeling personality seems to stand in direct opposition to Kate's unwavering perfectionism. Irish Televsion Premiere (S)(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship Essex struggle for their survival after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: Selfish publicist Stu Shepherd answers a ringing phone in the street. Not only does the man on the line know his name, but he's also got a sniper's rifle pointed directly at Stu(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to WWII, about an English aristocrat (Nicole Kidman) and the rugged drover (Hugh Jackman) who helps her with the cattle ranch she inherited(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Directors Bobby and Peter Farrelly making a film about conjoined twins sounds like the ideal recipe for stomach-churning grossness but Stuck on You gets its laughs from others, not the twins. Bo and Walt run a diner in Martha's Vineyard but Walt yearns for Hollywood stardom. Bo agrees to humour him and they hit LA, where Walt lands a part in a TV series starring Cher (the shy Bo has to be hidden by scenery or 'brushed out' from the scene). But Bo harbours a love for LA-based Man, their romance previously conducted on-line while Walt falls for April, an understanding pool babe. Can the disparate pair find love, success and happiness? With cameos from Jack Nicholson and Meryl Streep(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: A gripping drama based on the true story of the mission to rescue 33 miners who were trapped in a underground mine for 69 days(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Based on the true story of how Charlie Wilson, an alcoholic womaniser and Texas congressman, persuaded the CIA to train and arm resistance fighters in Afghanistan to fend off the Soviet Union. With the help of rogue CIA agent, Gust Avrakotos, the two men supplied money, training and a team of military experts that turned the ill-equipped Afghan freedom-fighters into a force that brought the Red Army to a stalemate and set the stage for conflicts in the Middle East that still rage to this day(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A supernatural being that can only be seen when the lights go out attacks a family and one of them has to step up to protect the others(n)

programme.desc: Margaret Cho, Emo Philips and Jaleel White are the panelists. Kato Kaelin cohosts(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride
programme.desc: Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride. As South Park Elementary's football team gears up for their big game against Middle Park, Stan's new dog Sparky is discovered to be gay. Feeling unwanted, Sparky runs away to Big Gay Al's animal sanctuary, where gay animals can live without fear and enjoy their own gay animal dance club. Stan finds Sparky and takes the Big Gay Boatride (which might also be called "It's a Gay World After All"), during which he realizes that it's OK to be gay. Stan returns to the football field, where he leads his team to a touchdown, beating the spread(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Jared Has Aides. The gang seizes upon an opportunity to make money with a weight-loss programme that's sweeping the country(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Night of the Living Homeless. As the number of homeless people in South Park begins to grow at an alarming rate, some begin to view their presence as an opportunity while others view it as evidence of a sad state of social inequity. When the vast majority of the population decides to simply ignore the problem, the unyielding quest by the indignant to obtain some spare change quickly spirals out of control(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.desc: 2000 Light Years from Home. Eric makes a bold move to get college money; Kelso wants to break up with Angie, who gets a promotion over Hyde(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Take It or Leave It. When the son of Red's Navy buddy (Bret Harrison) comes to visit, the gang is immediately put off by his lack of life experience(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Short & Curlies. Hyde gets another chance with Jackie; Charlie accidentally sees Kitty naked; and Donna arranges the perfect going-away present for Eric. Charlie: Bret Harrison. Kitty: Debra Jo Rupp. Red: Kurtwood Smith. Jackie: Mila Kunis(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Til the Next Goodbye. Eric gets his shots for Africa, which looks better and better after Red catches the boys smoking in the basement(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

Sam: Jud Tylor. Charlie: Bret Harrison. Jackie: Mila Kunis. Hyde: Danny Masterson. Kelso: Ashton Kutcher(n)

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.desc: Sweet Dee Gets Audited. While Dee tries to weasel her way out of an IRS audit, the guys set up a new (and, they say, democratic) way of running Paddy's(n)

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.desc: Frank's Brother. Frank's long-lost brother up unexpectedly and spills family secrets(n)

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.desc: Storm of the Century. It's not always sunny in Philadelphia: An apocalyptic storm is bearing down on the City of Brotherly Love and everyone's in panic mode, except for Frank(n)

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.sub-title: Chardee MacDennis: The Game of Games
programme.desc: Chardee MacDennis: The Game of Games. Another rainy day in Philadelphia. The gang can't go out and play, so they stay indoors and play a board game of their own devising. (It doesn't much resemble Chutes and Ladders). They also drink(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Honeypot. Malory's job is in danger after a sensitive videotape falls into the wrong hands, and she must rely on Archer's skills of seduction to save it. Guest voices include Ron Perlman (Ramon Limon) and Thomas Lennon (Charles)(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Skorpio. Malory chooses Lana over Archer for a mission to Saint-Tropez to take out an international arms dealer, and she accompanies Lana there as well---for a "conference" that turns out to be a tryst with her KGB paramour, Nikolai. While at the robot hospital, he finds Beck, and he invites him to sing with. They go on a tour, and Fry, Leela, Amy, and Zoidberg follow the bus in the van. The other broken robots consider him a hero, before their doom: being turned into tools. Meanwhile, the other crew is out of money, and are eating out of trash, until Zoidberg coughs up "Genuine Love Beads", and start selling them for money. Bender, while singing, gets a check, and starts moving. After their van falls, he recovers the check and they head home(n)

Finding themselves trapped in North Korea, it became clear they had to fight their way out or face certain death, heralding the Battle of Chosin Reservoir of December 1950.(n)

programme.title: Altered Statesmen
programme.desc: An insight into the mood swings suffered by Winston Churchill, who apparently made rash political decisions while under the influence of alcohol.(n)

programme.title: Commander in Chief
programme.desc: Examining how President George HW Bush's combination of skills as a diplomat, spy and politician were vital in the first modern war in the post-Cold-War world.(n)

programme.title: CIA Secrets
programme.desc: Methods used by agents investigating terrorist activity, and the threat of cyber attacks.(n)

programme.title: Jesus Code
programme.sub-title: The Bones of John the Baptist.
programme.desc: A set of human remains found in Bulgaria are claimed to be those of John, Jesus's cousin, who baptised him in the River Jordan in a pivotal moment in Christian history.(n)

programme.title: Biblical Conspiracies
programme.desc: Following an investigation into one of Michelangelo's early clay models that was destined to become the most venerated Christian sculpture in history.(n)

programme.title: Jesus: Man Behind the Myths
programme.desc: Bible scholar Kent Dobson tries to piece together the facts about Christ, asking how much the world truly knows about the man and his life.(n)

programme.title: Unsolved History

programme.title: Top Tens of Warfare

programme.title: Top Tens of Warfare
programme.desc: Archive footage and expert interviews are combined to rank the most influential fighting forces ever recorded on film, from Hitler's army in the Second World War, to the SAS.(n)

programme.title: Seven Ages of Britain
programme.desc: Bettany Hughes provides an insight into the seventh age of Britain between 1530 and 1700, from the Elizabethan era to the eve of the agricultural and industrial revolutions. The documentary chronicles the emergence of many characteristics of the modern nation, such as political rights, secular entertainment, capitalism and the creation of the middle class.(n)

programme.title: More Industrial Revelations
programme.desc: Mark Williams visits a pub cellar and bridges across the Tyne, all powered by hydraulics, revealing how the beer pump started a power revolution.(n)

programme.title: More Industrial Revelations
programme.desc: The development of the Cornish mining industry, from pebble-picking in streams to the building of a honeycomb of mines beneath the sea.(n)

programme.title: Weapons of War
programme.desc: An account of war in the central sector of the Eastern Front during the Second World War, from the 1941 advance into Russia to the juggernaut of the Soviets' counter-attack.(n)

programme.title: Ultimate Warfare
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Battle of the Bulge, which took place in 1944 when German forces cut off American troops in the Ardennes forests in a bid to halt the Allied advance.(n)

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The legacy of the American flying boat, which was once used for both commerce and combat.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Athelney, Somerset: Back to Our Roots.
programme.desc: In an edition first shown to mark the 100th episode of the archaeology show, Tony Robinson and the team revisit Athelney in Somerset, where King Alfred established a stronghold from which he campaigned to drive the Vikings out of England and unite the local kingdoms as a single nation. When Time Team first looked at Athelney, no digging was allowed at the site, but now excavations of the famous fortified abbey uncover a startling revelation about its origins.(n)

programme.title: Highly Questionable

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted--or rather, refereed--by boxing expert Max Kellerman, this lively cable-TV discussion show featured four sports columnists, each from a different part of the USA, discussing recent pro-athletic developments in a sort of electronic summit meeting. Kellerman determined how much time each of the columnists would be permitted to express his or her opinions--and he was harsh indeed, frequently limiting the discourse to ten seconds or less. At the end of the show, Kellerman would award points for the most cogent opinions and arguments, and also subtract points from contributors whom he determined had not effectively expressed themselves. The inagural episode of ESPN's Around the Horn was seen on September 30, 2002(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines what lies beneath a crocodile's hard exterior, discovering the secret to its ancient history and gaining an insight into one of the most sophisticated physiologies on the planet. By following all stages of a crocodile hunt, Chris reveals how their extraordinary circulatory system enables them to hold their breath for more than an hour, and looks at how their exceptionally sensitive skin detects their prey through water.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: Exploring places reclaimed by nature in Detroit and New Orleans, as well as on a Caribbean island.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Can We Make a Star on Earth?.
programme.desc: Despite decades of dedicated work, nuclear fusion researchers have been unable to produce electricity capable of supplying a national grid. This documentary witnesses experimental physicist Brian Cox embark on a global tour to discover whether nuclear fusion is a feasible energy source for the future. On his journey he visits a bomb-testing facility in America, and enters the reaction chamber of South Korea's K-Star - a complex that may hold the key to progress in the field of fusion research.(n)

programme.title: Bears - Spy in the Woods
programme.desc: Camouflaged cameras give an insight into the world of bears around the globe. The animals are filmed in their natural habitats from South America to Alaska as they hunt, scavenge and play, blissfully unaware their every move is being recorded. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals

programme.title: Life on Earth: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: An insight into revolutionary discoveries in the field of palaeontology, beginning with why modern insects are so much smaller than their prehistoric counterparts.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts examines the latest discoveries from the northern hemisphere to shed light on the lives and habitats of the creatures that dominated the planet 40,000 years ago. She begins by heading to North America, which was home to a diverse group of giant mammals, and discovers how the sabre-toothed cat's out-sized teeth were vital for hunting, yet easily broken. Alice looks at evidence of the bear-sized Shasta ground sloth in a cave in the Grand Canyon, and learns about the strange armadillo-like glyptodont - which was the size of a small car.(n)

programme.desc: Alice Roberts examines the latest discoveries from the northern hemisphere to shed light on the lives and habitats of the creatures that dominated the planet 40,000 years ago. She begins by heading to North America, which was home to a diverse group of giant mammals, and discovers how the sabre-toothed cat's out-sized teeth were vital for hunting, yet easily broken. Alice looks at evidence of the bear-sized Shasta ground sloth in a cave in the Grand Canyon, and learns about the strange armadillo-like glyptodont - which was the size of a small car.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Can We Make a Star on Earth?.
programme.desc: Despite decades of dedicated work, nuclear fusion researchers have been unable to produce electricity capable of supplying a national grid. This documentary witnesses experimental physicist Brian Cox embark on a global tour to discover whether nuclear fusion is a feasible energy source for the future. On his journey he visits a bomb-testing facility in America, and enters the reaction chamber of South Korea's K-Star - a complex that may hold the key to progress in the field of fusion research.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines what lies beneath a crocodile's hard exterior, discovering the secret to its ancient history and gaining an insight into one of the most sophisticated physiologies on the planet. By following all stages of a crocodile hunt, Chris reveals how their extraordinary circulatory system enables them to hold their breath for more than an hour, and looks at how their exceptionally sensitive skin detects their prey through water.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the lives and behaviour of the planet's fastest creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Trek: Spy on the Wildebeest
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary about Africa's great wildebeest migration, during which more than one million animals make the arduous 3,000km round trip across Tanzania's Serengeti and Kenya's Masai Mara. Remote spycams follow a calf as it tries to evade lions, cheetahs, hyenas and crocodiles, and faces some of nature's most gruelling physical challenges during the year-long journey.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: Observations of the sky over a 24-hour period, featuring thunderstorms, rainbows, sunset, temperature inversion and auroras at the poles.(n)

programme.title: The Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell and Ellie Harrison present the first of two programmes in which they embark on the ultimate treasure hunt, searching the globe to uncover its extraordinary riches, from natural gems to precious metals - and more besides. Dallas begins his search Down Under, free-diving for lustrous pearls in the waters around north-west Australia and seeking out diamonds from the bottom of the ocean. He also learns about opal mining in one of the most hostile places on Earth and, together with Ellie, reveals how ambergris, a substance that starts life in a sperm whale's stomach, can prove an expensive ingredient in perfume. Plus, how one of the largest and most unusual treasures has helped solve a 67-million-year-old puzzle.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary shot over the course of two years, providing an insight into work at Chengdu Research Base in central China. The programme details how workers at the sanctuary hope to breed 300 pandas as part of an ambitious conservation project, the final aim being to introduce them back into the wild and help bring the creatures back from the brink of extinction. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explains what the remains of mammals reveal about how they fared in cold climates. In Transylvanian caves, she discovers evidence of a conflict between a cave bear and a lion, both of which became victims of a deep freeze that swept across Europe, while in Siberia she finds that the well-preserved remains of a female woolly rhinoceros demonstrate it was perfectly evolved to face the bitter conditions in Yakutsk - the coldest city on Earth. Alice also travels to a Jersey cave, where archaeological findings shed light on how Ice Age human beings and Neanderthals fashioned stone tools to hunt mammoths.(n)

programme.title: Trek: Spy on the Wildebeest
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary about Africa's great wildebeest migration, during which more than one million animals make the arduous 3,000km round trip across Tanzania's Serengeti and Kenya's Masai Mara. programme.title: The Perfect Guy
programme.desc: A successful lobbyist jumps into a new relationship shortly after breaking up with her noncommittal boyfriend. But when her ex resurfaces she soon realizes that one of the two men is not who he appears to be(n)

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: Cate Blanchett stars in Sam Raimi's psychological thriller as a widow "blessed" with psychic powers. When she's asked to help investigate the brutal murder of a society girl, she uncovers a web of deceit and lies that the Georgia townsfolk hide behind. And as the investigation gathers pace, her life is increasingly placed in danger(n)

programme.title: Fever Pitch
programme.desc: Nick Hornby's acclaimed memoir about one man's struggle to balance his love of a woman and his love for soccer was the basis of a well-reviewed British film in 1997, and now gets a Americanized rewrite with this picture, in which the game is changed from soccer to baseball. Ben (Jimmy Fallon) is a high-school teacher who meets Lindsay (Drew Barrymore), who has a successful career in business. Ben and Lindsay don't appear to have much in common on the surface, but they hit it off and are soon involved in a serious romance. But when spring rolls around, Lindsay becomes aware of the true love of Ben's life -- the Boston Red Sox. Despite the team's lamentable record, Ben has been a fiercely loyal Red Sox fan since childhood, and Lindsay finds it hard to compete with his passion for baseball, while Ben is forced to choose between the obsessions of his youth and the enthusiasms of a responsible adult. Fever Pitch was shot in part in Boston during the 2004 baseball season, which to the surprise of the filmmakers saw the Red Sox winning baseball's world series for the first time since 1918(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: An ex-Playboy Bunny becomes house mother to a sorority of geeky misfits after she is ousted from the Playboy Mansion. The girls desperately need to attract more members or they will lose their house, but can their new member make them cool without compromising their true selves?(n)

programme.title: Moonstruck
programme.desc: Superstitious Italian-American widow Loretta is sort of happy to be engaged again, but it's her fiancé's hot-tempered younger brother Ronny who relights her fire(n)

programme.desc: In Plane Sight. The A-Team is hired by Judy Rogers (Judy Strangis), the cousin of a pilot who has been arrested by the Feds in Venezuela for smuggling cocaine from Colombia. Adopting a wide (and wild) variety of disguises, the A-Team heads South of the Border to execute a daring plan whereby Corliss and his minions will be lured into the clutches of the authorities. programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: Driver and muscle for hire Frank Martin returns in this sequel to the 2002 box-office hit. Frank Martin (Jason Statham) is a former special-forces officer who will transport anything anywhere for a price, and his latest assignment is acting as chauffeur for Jack Billings (Hunter Clary), the young son of politician Jefferson Billings (Matthew Modine), who has garnered no small amount of controversy for his aggressive efforts to stamp out the trade in illegal drugs. One day, Frank is to take Jack to the doctor for a checkup while his mother, Audrey (Amber Valletta), sets up a birthday party for the tyke. However, Jack's doctor is not who he appears to be -- he's actually Dimitri (Jason Flemyng), a Russian agent well versed in viruses who works with criminal kingpin Gianni (Alessandro Gassman). After a long and hard-fought chase with Frank, the bad guys get ahold of little Jack and hold him for ransom. The parents comply with their monetary demands and soon have their son back at home -- but little do they know that the boy has secretly been injected with a deadly and easily spread virus, which the terrorists hope to spread to the boy's powerful father and other politicians whom Jefferson will soon be addressing at a public event. When Frank learns what has happened to young Jack, he sets out to find the culprits -- and the antidote that will save the boy and all others who have been exposed to the virus from dying a painful death -- though his foes have stacked the deck so that it looks as if Frank has been complicit in the crime(n)

programme.title: Burn Notice
programme.desc: Sam's girlfriend alleges that her son has stolen a valuable piece of jewellery. Jesse tries to retrieve it, and finds Evan in the midst of packing up to leave town due to a brutal loan shark who is threatening to break his legs unless he steals an 18-wheel truck seemingly filled with black-market liquor. However, they soon learn the vehicle contains something much more dangerous.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the death of a teenager who was due to appear in court to testify that a man convicted of murdering a Korean couple was not actually the culprit. However, several unexpected twists in the case make her wonder whether the boy was really going to tell the truth. Meanwhile, disaster strikes when Pope's ex-wife exposes one of his past relationships. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The wife of a crime boss is murdered in FBI custody. Brenda suspects the agent supposedly protecting her was corrupt and hastily tries to interrogate him before the FBI can regain control of the investigation. As the case unfolds, the team learns today's Mafia do not follow the traditional rules any more. Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of a wealthy businessman's children in his apartment. At first the victims' stepmother seems the most likely culprit, but the team is also suspicious of two nannies with ties to the grieving family. Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The hunt for a missing woman leads Goren and Eames to a political activist's apartment, where they find deadly materials including rat poison - a known bomb-making ingredient. After receiving a chilling video message and questioning a suspect, the detectives soon realise a forthcoming Veteran's Day parade is being targeted.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is forced to take a step back from work when his increasingly frail father Jackson begs him to help track down an old friend from the Second World War who does not have long left to live. Meanwhile, the rest of the team investigate the death of a marine sergeant who appears to have been caught in the crossfire during a bungled robbery, but Tony and Tim find evidence the victim may have been targeted. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Jody Ray is killed by a hit-and-run driver and evidence points to staff sergeant Justin Dunne, whose guilt seems certain when DiNozzo and McGee find him washing a bloodstained knife when they go to arrest him. However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka).(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brenda takes involuntary leave, but ends up assisting an investigation into a murder linked to a terrorist group, while Commander Taylor takes advantage of her enforced layoff to try to break up the PHD. Crime drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brenda discovers she has been given false information while attempting to find a terrorist-linked suspect. She is forced to untangle a web of deceit to determine who she can trust and prevent the PHD becoming the victims of a sinister plan.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate the contract killing of a businessman's wife. Evidence at the scene points to two assailants, one of whom was wearing a bandage, and the victim's mother-in-law becomes the chief suspect. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A man admits to killing his father and half-brother, but Goren and Eames discover he had been heavily influenced by a self-improvement guru. The detectives are forced to take an unorthodox approach to discover whether the chief suspect was coerced into carrying out the murders.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An internal security breach forces NCIS to go into lockdown when a covert listening device is found in a pen belonging to Secretary of the Navy Sarah Porter. DiNozzo discovers that National Security Agency analyst Ellie Bishop wrote a report two years previously predicting the possibility of such an occurrence and she is brought in to assist with the investigation and track down the culprit. Guest starring Leslie Hope and Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate when marine corporal Flegman is found shot to death, and a phone leads them to a hotel room where Gibbs awkwardly stumbles upon his ex-wife Diane Sterling and her FBI agent ex-husband TC Fornell. She had been attempting to call her boyfriend Eddie to break up with him, but somehow Flegman had taken possession of his phone. The team tracks down Eddie's car and discovers a clown nose along with traces of blood and he quickly becomes the prime suspect.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The death of a petty officer prompts the team to once again enlist the help of private detectives The Sherlocks, and their newest recruit - Anthony DiNozzo Sr.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: A professional eSports video game player accused of throwing a championship game, so he enlists Bull to help him sue his former team manager for defamation.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris wants to start a new hobby and befriends a puppeteer named Franz, an old friend of Herbert's. Despite hearing warnings about the entertainer's past, the duo remain friends until Franz's dark history is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: The Hand That Rocks the Wheelchair.
programme.desc: Meg offers to look after Joe while Bonnie is out of town, but her enthusiasm for the task begins to grow increasingly disturbing. Elsewhere, Stewie worries his reputation as the toughest baby around is beginning to slip, and hooks himself up to a machine he hopes will increase his evil urges. Comedy, featuring the voices of Mila Kunis and Patrick Warburton.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan finally saves enough money to join the golf club he has worked at for the past 30 summers - only to discover Steve has been given a membership before him. However, everything changes when the CIA officer learns who owns the business. Featuring the voice of Hulk Hogan.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: Wheels and the Legman and the Case of Grandpa's Key.
programme.desc: Stan joins Roger and Steve's fictional detective agency, but proves to be surprisingly incompetent at his imaginary job. An infuriated Roger orders Steve to fire him - but the youngster cannot bring himself to do it. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter loses his job at the Happy-Go-Lucky toy factory, but the blow is cushioned by an unexpected windfall in the form of a massive welfare payout. First-ever episode of the animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: I Never Met the Dead Man.
programme.desc: Peter unwittingly destroys the town's TV transmitter and persuades Meg to take the blame by promising to buy her a car. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to build a weather control device in a misguided bid to rid the world of broccoli.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan creates attractive alter ego Phyllis in a desperate bid to bond with his son, but when he takes things too far, Francine is forced to intervene. Elsewhere, a group of men takes advantage of Roger's new limousine service, prompting him to set out on a manhunt to exact revenge. With the guest voices of Sarah Michelle Gellar and Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A jealous Francine tries to break up Stan's renewed relationship with a former girlfriend, only to unwittingly leave Roger at the mercy of an alien-hunter. Elsewhere, Steve accidentally wears Hayley's panties to school, and finds they bring him luck.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois befriends local news presenter Joyce Kinney, who asks for permission to film a feature depicting her as the model American housewife. However, the report ends up making her look like a fool, so she sets out to put things right.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Brian are forced to attend a 12-step AA meeting to kick their drinking habits following a public disturbance. While the dog decides to mend his ways, Peter refuses to admit he has a problem, prompting Death to intervene and show him what his life would be like without alcohol.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Fr Donovan organises a Christmas play at the shopping centre, and casts Stan as Santa Claus and Roger as Jesus - but they land themselves in trouble after getting into a fight with each other. Elsewhere, Hayley and Jeff adopt a child, who turns out to be possessed.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve tries to prove his toughness to Stan by adopting the persona of a superhero, while Francine also goes through an identity crisis when she receives news that could change the family for ever.(n)

programme.desc: A teenager becomes the prime suspect in the murder of his family, and Brenda tries to resist the imposition of budget cuts at LAPD. Detective drama starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda puts a priest under investigation in connection with the death of a gang member, but learns he has an unexpected defender - Sergeant Gabriel. Back at home, she has to deal with her father, who knows that she and Fritz are living together.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A troubled airport baggage supervisor is found murdered, prompting Goren and Eames to interrogate her colleagues about their reasons for distrusting her. The policemen finally uncover evidence of an operation that could well have been enough reason to silence the victim. Detective drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate when the owner of one of the city's most exclusive hotels is found dead from a fatal injection of Botox, and suspicion falls on her unstable daughter, who resented her mother's interference in her love life. Crime drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigate when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs investigates the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed by a stolen surveillance drone and the team links it to elusive terrorist Benham Parsa. NCIS joins forces with the Department of Defence to track down the device before it is used for a large-scale attack, but Gibbs is less than pleased that he has to work with his ex-lover Hollis Mann. Meanwhile, McGee hopes he will be granted time off to attend a black-tie gala honouring his girlfriend Delilah. Guest starring Susanna Thompson (Arrow).(n)

programme.desc: A major threat forces CTU to go on lockdown. Meanwhile, Carter finds himself in a tense situation, and Donovan reaches out to Rebecca when he faces a big decision in his campaign.(n)

programme.title: Chronicle
programme.desc: A loner (Dane DeHaan) escapes his abusive home life and discovers a mysterious crater that gives him and two fellow high school students psychokinetic powers in this found-footage-style superhero film from director Josh Trank and screenwriter Max Landis. DeHaan plays Andrew, a angsty teen whose mother is dying and whose father takes out his violent frustrations out on the boy. As a result, Andrew starts filming everything around him, including the dreadful night that he, his cousin Matt (Alex Russell) and the soon-to-be senior class president, Steve (Michael B. Jordan), wake up with superpowers after exploring a condemned piece of land housing an unexplained power source. The three bond over their newfound abilities, with Andrew clearly leading the pack in terms of control and strength. Despite their noble intentions, a darker streak appears in one of them as the other two try to take control over a situation that soon spirals into homicidal madness -- all of which is captured on camera(n)

Action adventure sequel, starring Bruce Willis and Jai Courtney.(n)

Comedy, with Jackie Chan and Magnus Scheving.(n)

In later life, one pair, brought up in a poor mining town, visits New York to challenge a powerful conglomerate - only to find their respective siblings are in charge of the company. Comedy, starring Bette Midler and Lily Tomlin in dual roles alongside Fred Ward and Edward Herrmann.(n)

programme.desc: Ree cooks up a celebration dinner for her husband's birthday, with chili cheese burgers, crisp thin fries, a wedge salad and a yellow cake with a chocolate buttercream frosting.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her middle children with a week of food and fun while the others are away, making cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup, chicken alfredo and grilled fruit pizzas.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's raids the pantry, and makes a fragrant chickpea curry with rice, then for sweet treats in a hurry, no-bake peanut butter bars save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's father-in-law, Chuck, is spearheading a big fence fixing project on the ranch, so Ree is saying thank you by delivering him and his crew a Tex-Mex lunch.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their dietary challenge by reinventing favourite family meals. They prepare a cooked breakfast that delivers all the excitement of a fry-up without adding to the waistline, and a calorie-conscious roast chicken dinner. They also rework French classic the cassoulet and set it before a couple of famished rugby teams, and make the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to help shift the pounds - give up their beloved motorbikes in favour of bicycles.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo guides us through the new fusion food trends in Korea's capital Seoul, from fried chicken to Korean Mexican tacos and cocktails.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Judy Joo samples Korea's best street food, visiting the street markets of Seoul and Busan. Back home, she offers simple versions of street food dishes, Japchae noodles with prawns.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver continues to present quick and easy recipes. In this edition, he prepares flashy fish stew with saffron sauce and garlic bread, before making seared Asian beef, best noodle salad and ginger dressing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares another selection of quick meals, including crispy Camembert parcels, an autumn salad with cranberry dip and a golden chicken with braised greens and potato gratin.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their dietary challenge by reinventing favourite family meals. They prepare a cooked breakfast that delivers all the excitement of a fry-up without adding to the waistline, and a calorie-conscious roast chicken dinner. They also rework French classic the cassoulet and set it before a couple of famished rugby teams, and make the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to help shift the pounds - give up their beloved motorbikes in favour of bicycles.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares food with herbs, including lemon-rosemary scones, French onion soup with fresh thyme, a panzanella salad with basil, and a minty raita with salted naan wedges.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's bakes a caramel apple pie and a frozen grasshopper pie, as well as strawberry pretzel pie and mini blueberry galettes.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Chef Judy Joo introduces some of the most traditional, classic Korean dishes of bibimpap, tofu and bossam. Back in her kitchen, she puts her own twist on these family classics.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo introduces us to her family for birthday celebrations, lunchbox designing and Kimchi making - because good Korean food is all about family and sharing.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: The four remaining bakers take inspiration from typical Mother's Day gifts for their own desserts and chocolates.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers come up with a fat-friendly pie for fellow dieter Ann, baking a pastry treat that comes in below the 700 calories of a standard pork pie - but keen to lose as much weight as they can, they don't taste it themselves. Moving on to Dave's home town of Barrow-in-Furness in Cumbria, the duo try to persuade the diners in Chinese and Indian restaurants that their favourite dishes can be even better with all the fattening elements removed.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares his recipe for beef stroganoff accompanied by fluffy rice, and a red onion and parsley pickle. He also makes Moroccan-style mussels with tapenade toasties and cucumber salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares more quick meals, including fish baps, mushy peas and tartare sauce, plus mushroom farfalle with blue cheese and a hazelnut and apple salad.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a taco restaurant in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico which serves fresh octopus tacos and hot Guadalajaran-inspired sauces.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a restaurant specialising in barbecued food in Hendersonville, Tennessee.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps former professional hockey player Bob Fleming with his struggling Hammer's Grill and Bar.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: A restaurant owner appeals for help to save his Italian restaurant after his staff have created a bad atmosphere, and his business is suffering.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Fearing that a rivalry between her bartenders is the cause of missing alcohol, Sarra asks Charles Stiles to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When Isabel and Todd have a dispute over which waiter to promote to manager, they contact Charles Stiles to mediate. Mystery Diners discover one of the candidates is being sabotaged from within.(n)

programme.desc: The announcement of Jean and Lionel's wedding date gives the neighbourhood women the perfect opportunity to go shopping for new outfits - until the bride-to-be is accused of shoplifting. Comedy, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads

James Bolam and Rodney Bewes star, with Brian Glover and Donald Gee.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy finds an interest in camcorders, much to the annoyance of some country ramblers. When later playing his footage back on Pearl's video machine, it becomes apparent the lens has inadvertently caught her and Howard in a compromising situation. Brian Wilde stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When Auntie Wainwright forces a gigantic tractor wheel on the trio, Foggy decides to craft a vehicle out of it. However, in doing so he manages to prove that the invention of the wheel might not have been such a good idea after all. Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy ropes Compo and Clegg into reconstructing a battle when a pit at a building site brings back memories of his wartime exploits. Comedy, starring Brain Wilde and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining amateur bakers face three tasks designed to test their bread-making skills, beginning by preparing two varieties of flatbread for judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. The hopefuls then tackle a demanding technical challenge as they try to replicate Paul's recipe for an eight-strand plaited loaf, before receiving the dubious honour of becoming the first contestants in the show's history to make bagels. At the end of the day, Paul and Mary must decide who is this round's Star Baker - and who will be going home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The three finalists face their penultimate challenge as they cook for 30 of the world's best chefs. Each contender has a main course and a dessert of their own creation on the menu, and their respected guests will decide what they want to order. They must go all out to impress with dishes that showcase their skill, technique and flair, as well as their ability to deliver excellence and innovation.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate British dairy products, preparing a classic cheese and onion turnover, a trinity cream and a number of traditional milk puddings. They also look at the history of school milk and Cheddar cheese.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker demonstrates how to make a variety of enriched breads, preparing a Sicilian lemon and orange bread with a sweet almond glaze. He teaches a local baking club how to make lardy cakes and cooks Danish pastries with onion, mushroom and Emmental, and Swedish Easter semlor buns. He rounds off with a savoury brioche crown with mozzarella and Parma ham.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: The chef's culinary journey to discover the best buns and fabulous bakes in America continues as James samples butter cake and meets a man who makes authentic Key lime pies in Brooklyn.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip reaches a conclusion as he arrives in Istanbul, just in time for the bluefish season, which allows him the chance to enjoy a fishing expedition on the Bosphorus, one of the world's most strategic waterways, which divides the city into two continents. Rick also cooks two much-loved local dishes - lavish kofte kebabs with pistachios, and kapuska, a hearty traditional Turkish cuisine stew from the Black Sea region, whose name is derived from the Russian word for cabbage.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: John Catucci annihilates punk rock burgers at Vancouver's Cannibal Cafe, then discovers Southwestern breakfast at Baja Cafe in Tucson, Arizona.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining amateur cooks' tart-making abilities are put to the test in the third round of the competition. Their first task is to bake a tarte Tatin, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry looking for intriguing flavour combinations to tickle their tastebuds. The hopefuls then face another daunting technical challenge as they try to replicate Mary's seemingly straightforward recipe for treacle tart, but the delicate task of adding a lattice top leaves some contestants flummoxed. Finally, they try to create an ornate fruit tart fit for gracing the window display of a leading patisserie - before discovering the identities of the latest Star Baker and the person who will be heading home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: After six gruelling weeks, the finalists' last challenge is to prepare a three-course menu for Michel Roux Jr, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace, drawing on everything they have learnt during the competition and over the course of their careers. The judges assess their efforts before deciding who will be crowned champion, succeeding last year's joint winners Keri Moss and Anton Piotrowski.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore more of the nation's dishes, beginning by showing there is more to British fowl than roast chicken. They prepare duck tikka and a one-pot partridge recipes before tasting a traditional Yorkshire Christmas pie and revealing the history of the Norfolk black turkey.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: Part one of two. The chef's culinary journey to discover America's best cakes and buns continues with a visit to a New York bakery made famous by Sex and the City. James also prepares a strawberry gateaux and cornflake cookies.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef's culinary journey continues with a lesson about two classic puddings from the Big Apple - New York cheesecake and baked Alaska.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall spends a summer living on a vegetarian diet, and shows viewers how to create varied and exciting meals without using meat or fish. He begins by exploring the range of vegetables growing in his own garden at River Cottage, before sampling Asian-inspired recipes created by vegetarian chef David Bailey and taking on the challenge of hosting a meat-free barbecue, with dishes including halloumi, tomato and potato kebabs and chard and samphire tarts.(n)

programme.title: Abortion: Stories Women Tell
programme.desc: Director Tracy Droz Tragos examines the debate over abortion rights in her home state of Missouri by telling the personal stories of numerous womens' experiences in this documentary. Missouri has become a state with some of the most restrictive abortion legislation, with laws requiring mandatory counseling and waiting periods before access to the procedure(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: A gifted forger and confidence man attempts to stay one step ahead of the lawman determined to bring him to justice in this comedy-drama from Steven Spielberg, based on a true story. Frank W. Abagnale Jr. (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a 16-year-old high school student who finds himself emotionally cut adrift when his mother, Paula (Nathalie Baye), leaves his father, Frank Abagnale Sr. (Christopher Walken), after Frank Sr. falls into arrears with the Internal Revenue Service. One day at school, Frank Jr. attempts to pass himself off as a substitute teacher, and easily makes the subterfuge work. His small-scale success gives Frank some ideas, and he soon discovers bigger and more profitable ways of hoaxing others, passing himself off as an airline pilot, a doctor, and an attorney. Along the way, Frank learns how to become a master forger, and uses his talent and charm to pass over 2.5 million dollars in phony checks. Frank's increasingly audacious work soon attracts the attention of Carl Hanratty (Tom Hanks), an FBI agent who is determined to put Frank behind bars. Frank seems to enjoy being pursued by Carl, and even goes so far as to call Carl on the phone to chat every once in a while. While posing as a doctor, Frank falls in love with Brenda Strong (Amy Adams), a sweet girl working as a candy striper. When Frank asks Brenda to marry him, he decides to assume a new identity to impress her father, Roger (Martin Sheen) -- who happens to be the District Attorney of New Orleans, LA. Catch Me If You Can was based on the autobiography of the real Frank W. Abagnale Jr., who has a cameo in the film and today works on the side of the law as a top consultant on preventing forgery and designing secure checking systems(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him on a Pacific island(n)

However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain (Christoph Waltz) who has sinister plans for his old home. David Yates directed this adaptation of Edgar Rice Burroughs' classic tales. Samuel L. Jackson, Djimon Hounsou, John Hurt, and Jim Broadbent co-star(n)

programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Squirrels. A squirrel's remarriage in a quarantined New York City finds one of her sons trying to impress a female guest, while the other plots to stop the wedding and squares off with his attention-hogging, soon-to-be little brother(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Gifted'
programme.desc: A look at "Gifted," a 2017 drama about a man doing his best to raise his 7-year-old niece, whose emergence as a math prodigy leads to a custody battle between the man and his mother. The film stars Chris Evans, Mckenna Grace and Lindsay Duncan, and is directed Marc Webb(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik, a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? But the host of the show, Prem Kumar is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. Along the way, Jamal falls in love with Latika, an orphaned girl, but the pair become separated. Meanwhile his brother Salim takes the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust, setting up an emotional, joyous climax. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: Professor Trevor Anderson embarks on a perilous trip into the core of the Earth. Action adventure(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Ride Along 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Ride Along 2," a 2016 comedy that follows an aspiring cop and his veteran partner—and future brother-in-law—as they pursue a Miami drug lord. The sequel to the 2014 hit stars Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Benjamin Bratt, and is directed by Tim Story(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: The Matrix masterminds Andy and Larry Wachowski usher anime icon Tatsuo Yoshida's classic 1960s-era hit into the new millennium with this family-friendly story of a young racecar driver who takes on the mysterious Racer X in a custom-made, gadget-loaded speed machine named the Mach 5. Speed Racer (Emile Hirsch) is the kind of driver that every wheelman wishes he could be: a born winner whose unbeatable combination of aggression, instinct, and fearlessness always finds him crossing the checkered flag with a comfortable lead. In Speed Racer's mind, the only driver who could present him with any real challenge is his late brother -- the legendary Rex Racer. Rex died in a heated cross-country rally known as The Crucible many years ago, and now his younger sibling is driven to fulfill the legacy that Rex left behind. To this day, Speed Racer is fiercely loyal to family. It was Speed Racer's father, Pops Racer (John Goodman), who designed the unbeatable Mach 5, and even a lucrative offer from racing giants Royalton Industries isn't enough to get the young ace to break his family ties. Upon turning down Royalton's (Roger Allam) astronomical offer, Speed Racer makes the shocking discovery that the outcomes of the biggest races are being predetermined by a handful of powerful moguls who pad their profits by manipulating the drivers. Realizing that his career would be ruined if word of the fix gets out, Royalton vows that the Mach 5 will never make it to another finish line. Now, the only way for Speed Racer to save the family business and beat Royalton at his own game will be to win the very same race that claimed his brother's life so many years ago. In order to accomplish that formidable feat, however, Speed Racer will not only have to rely on his family and the aid of his longtime girlfriend, Trixie (Christina Ricci), but form a tenuous alliance with his longtime rival -- the mysterious Racer X (Matthew Fox) -- as well(n)

programme.title: Rock and a Hard Place
programme.desc: A chronicle of a 16-week boot camp for incarcerated young people run by the Miami-Dade County Corrections and Rehabilitation Department that aims to make them constructive members of society who are less likely to return to prison. Dwayne Johnson is an executive producer(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Fact-based tale about GIs in Vietnam who volunteer to corral an elephant for a village's ceremonial ritual(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Sophie (Amanda Seyfried) has one wish for her wedding day: to have her father walk her down the aisle. Now she just has to figure out who he is. Meryl Streep, Julie Waters, Christine Baranski, Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth and Stellan Skarsgard round up the stellar cast of this irresistibly charming musical adventure that celebrates mothers, daughters, fathers and true love to the rhythm of some uniquely catchy tunes. Based on the Broadway smash-hit and filled with the ABBA songs you know and love, the film will make you dance, jive and have the time of your life(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Taking a break from her long-term boyfriend Josh (Nicholas Braun), Alice (Dakota Johnson) sets out on a journey of self-discovery with her hard-drinking new friend Robin (Rebel Wilson). Meanwhile, Alice's career-driven older sister Meg (Leslie Mann) struggles with the idea of settling down, and uptight romantic Lucy (Alison Brie) searches for her perfect match. Adapted from former Sex and the City writer Liz Tuccillo's debut novel, this modern rom com was directed by Christian Ditter(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: The undefeated UConn Huskies (36-0) head to their 10th straight Final Four in pursuit of their fifth-consecutive national championship in Dallas. In a stunning upset, Mississippi State ends the Huskies' reign in a captivating overtime thriller(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Director Robby Henson's psychological thriller House concerns a husband and wife who, attempting to patch up their marriage after the death of their child, decide on a spur of the moment to ignore their regularly scheduled therapy session and set off on a trip. After a car accident incapacitates their vehicle, the duo ends up at the title dwelling, where they meet another couple as well as the off-putting people who own the establishment. Soon, the two couples realize they must rely on each other in order to survive(n)

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Ridley Scott directs the crime comedy Matchstick Men, based on the novel of the same name by Eric Garcia. Neurotic con man Roy (Nicolas Cage) suffers from several emotional problems, including obsessive-compulsive disorder. He and his partner Frank (Sam Rockwell) swindle people out of money by posing as money collectors who promise things like tax refunds, package vacations, and other fabulous prizes (which they never get). Frank wants to pull a really big job, but Roy is too consumed with fear and panic attacks to join him. Only cigarettes and his trusty illegal prescription drugs seem to keep him going. When Roy finds himself in desperate need of more pills, he is forced to see legitimate psychotherapist Dr. Klein (Bruce Altman). Roy ends up talking about his emotional damage from a troubled marriage and divorce, which results in the discovery of a child whom he has never met. Dr. Klein suggests that he spend a weekend with the kid, so in walks teenaged Angela (played by twentysomething Alison Lohman). Reluctant to develop his role as a father, Roy also gets heavily involved in Frank's ambitious swindle(n)

programme.title: Nights in Rodanthe
programme.desc: A doctor is en route to reconcile with his estranged son when his benevolent mission is sidelined upon checking into a North Carolina beach-town inn. When the doctor arrives at the inn, he enters into a passionate affair with an unhappily married woman who is currently considering divorce. Network Television Premiere(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Race'
programme.desc: A look at "Race," a 2016 drama about track-and-field legend Jesse Owens and his performance at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin. The film stars Stephan James, Jason Sudeikis and Jeremy Irons, and is directed by Stephen Hopkins(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Based on the life of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens, who became the greatest track and field athlete in history at the world stage of the 1936 Olympics by winning four gold medals. He achieved this amazing feat under the gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: The stunning romantic drama which won a total of nine Oscars and focuses on a mysterious man who is almost killed in a 'plane crash in Africa during World War II. He survives, but with ghastly burns to his flesh, and is cared for by a young nurse (Juliette Binoche) in a derelict monastery in Italy. As the stories of his life before the accident and the woman who fell for him gradually unfold, the nurse finds her own romantic life taking an interesting turn, encouraged by her curious new patient..(n)

programme.title: Cocoon
programme.desc: A group of elderly men discover the rejuvenating effects of of alien pods in an abandoned swimming pool. The aliens swear the men to secrecy but rejuvination is to big a secret to keep to themselves(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Gifted'
programme.desc: A look at "Gifted," a 2017 drama about a man doing his best to raise his 7-year-old niece, whose emergence as a math prodigy leads to a custody battle between the man and his mother. The film stars Chris Evans, Mckenna Grace and Lindsay Duncan, and is directed Marc Webb(n)

programme.title: Vice

programme.title: Crashing

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This biographical drama explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs through the lens of three product launches(n)

programme.title: High Crimes
programme.desc: High powered lawyer Claire Kubik finds her world turned upside down when her husband, who she thought was Tom Kubik, is arrested and is revealed to be Ron Chapman. Chapman is on trial for a murder of Latin American villagers while he was in the Marines. Claire soon learns that to navigate the military justice system, she'll need help from the somewhat unconventional Charlie Grimes; meanwhile, Claire's sister, Jackie, is falling in love with wet-behind-the-ears Lieutenant Embry assigned as the official defense lawyer. And most of the eyewitnesses have rather too conveniently died(n)

programme.title: Cries from Syria

programme.title: Temple Grandin

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube and Chris Tucker (star of the Rush Hour movies) are two LA guys hanging out on a Friday - Ice Cube's just been fired from his job but Tucker has a more serious concern - he smoked rather than sold the $200 stash of dope he got from Faizon Love. Now the two have a choice - find the money by the end of the day or enter a whole world of pain in F Gary Gray's black comedy(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Just minutes after he takes delivery of a spanking new BMW, yuppie Daniel Miller dies when he ploughs into a bus. Arriving in heavenly Judgment City, Miller must defend his right to an hedonistic afterlife where people can eat without ever getting fat. Fantasy, comedy, romance and satire(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Dom Irrera: Command Performance. Before a backdrop of photos, Dom Irrera uses strong language and sexual material to talk about family, friends and others who are "without any concept of themselves." Also: big-name entertainers; growing up in Philadelphia(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about an alcoholic millionaire threatened with losing his inheritance if he does not marry the girl of his parents' choosing. Despite his dislike for his prospective bride, he bows to the inevitable only to meet a light-fingered waitress who steals his heart. John Gielgud won an Oscar for his role as Arthur's loyal but outspoken valet(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: An undercover cop is assigned to escort a fugitive to Los Angeles, where his testimony will help put a drug lord behind bars(n)

programme.title: Down Periscope
programme.desc: Matthew Perry stars in this romcom. A one night stand in Las Vegas leads to pregnancy, marriage and - eventually - love(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: An estranged husband-and-wife treasure hunting team decide to patch up their differences when news breaks of a potentially massive haul of booty on an old shipwreck on an island off the Florida coast. However, the murderous gangster rapper who owns the isle has brought in a rival bounty hunter, forcing the pair to battle against time - and their marital difficulties - if they are to reach the golden galleon(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Michelle Darnell is a successful businesswoman who is sent to prison after being convicted of insider trading. She tries to start over after being released, but not everyone is ready to forgive and forget(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: The Bonfire of the Vanities
programme.desc: Bond trader Sherman McCoy calls himself 'Master of the Universe.' His glitzy life of limousines and champagne is threatened when his mistress mistakes a black teenager for a mugger and runs him over. Based on a brilliant book by Tom Wolfe(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A private investigator and a hired enforcer team up to solve the case of a missing girl and the alleged suicide of a once-prominent porn star, but they begin to uncover a conspiracy instead(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: Upon his release from prison, now-brotherless Blues Brother Jake Elwood puts the band back together with the help of a golden-voiced strip joint bartender and a precocious 10-year-old orphan on loan from the comically abusive Sister Mary Stigmata(n)
